main event: Civilians observed an orange colored object moving swiftly across the sky in Arlington, Virginia in August 1957.
interesting points: The object was described as being the size of a pea or pinhead at arm's length,Traveling at an estimated speed of not less than 2000 mph, A sketch of the object was prepared by the source as part of the report, The investigation concluded the object was probably a jet aircraft with after-burner in operation, Multiple investigations were conducted with negative results from various airbases and observatories.
witness description: Civilians, including a housewife and others who reported seeing the object in the sky.
